programme.title: The Final Days of the Nazis
programme.desc: Witness what happened to Hitler's circle after WWII and how justice was sought for the Nazi regime's horrors.

programme.title: Nazi Law: Legally Blind
programme.desc: Dictator Adolf Hitler revoked citizenship rights for German Jews and deprived many others of their rights.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: Hitler’s fascination with propaganda was born in the trenches of WWI. Then he refined it to win Germany.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: Hitler’s approach to propaganda was one of persuasion and terror, all in service of the Führer.

programme.title: Hitler's Propaganda Machine
programme.desc: This episode investigates the role propaganda played for both Hitler and the Allies to mobilize for war.

programme.title: Normandy 44': D-Day and the Battle for France
programme.desc: Hosts James Holland and Mike Simpson examine the preparations for the D-Day invasion across southern England.

programme.title: Normandy 44': D-Day and the Battle for France
programme.desc: The real fighting begins. Examine the Candians’ first encounters with the Waffen SS in vital battles.

programme.title: Normandy 44': D-Day and the Battle for France
programme.desc: James and Mike turn their attention to Operation COBRA as they range deep into Normandy.

programme.title: Hitler's Mein Kampf: Prelude to the Holocaust
programme.desc: Examine the clues Hitler left for his dark vision of Germany's abhorrent future in his treatise Mein Kampf.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Allied forces stumble across a sprawling complex in the French countryside with bunkers fit for the Fūhrer.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A chilling WWII discovery in easternmost Canada hints at the depths of the Nazis’ seafaring capabilities.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: In Poland's Kamienna Gora, Hitler's scientists secretly build a machine to punish an unsuspecting enemy.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A network of Nazi bunkers buried in the Hague tells the story of the greatest battle of WWII that never was.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: As wartime tensions grow, crime boss Billy Hill takes advantage of the chaos in London during WWII's Blitz.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: The WWII Nazi occupation freed Dr. Marcel Petio's criminal instincts, enabling him to go on a killing spree.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: When the U.S. military took over the German Kronberg Castle in 1945, it resulted in a massive treasure heist.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: In 1943, when U.S. servicemen attacked Hispanic youths, the police arrested the youths, not the attackers.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: During WWII blackouts in Berlin and London, police race to catch serial killers who use darkness for cover.

programme.title: Wartime Crime
programme.desc: Mafiosi, including big kingpin Charles "Lucky" Luciano, offered support to the WWII American intelligence.
